intro: Carex hypandra, commonly known as narrowleaf sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. Native to North America, it thrives in wet or moist environments such as marshes and stream banks. The plant has a rhizomatous root system that helps it spread and establish in suitable habitats. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
